p: The nasolacrimal system, via the nasopharynx (considered crucial for viral replication [ 46]) thus provides a bridge between ocular and respiratory tissues, serving as a conduit for virus-containing fluid exchange between these sites [ 60]. Furthermore, beyond the anatomical linkage, it was recognized that the structure and distribution of cellular receptors in these systems is likely contributing to the tissue tropism of respiratory viruses [ 60]. Furthermore, there is respiratory-ocular mucosal immune interdependence with linkage via the nasolacrimal lymphoid tissue [ 6, 61].
